snippet: Demonstrations were reported in several cities as the government offered mixed signals on whether it would continue to tolerate the sometimes violent outbursts.
abstract: Anti-Japanese demonstrations continue across China, as the government offers mixed signals on whether it will continue to tolerate the sometimes violent outbursts over the disputed island chain in the East China Sea.

byline.original: By IAN JOHNSON and THOM SHANKER
byline.contributor: Ian Johnson reported from Beijing, and Thom Shanker from Tokyo.

lead_paragraph: Demonstrations were reported in several cities as the government offered mixed signals on whether it would continue to tolerate the sometimes violent outbursts.

headline.seo: Anti-Japanese Protests Over Disputed Islands Continue in China
headline.main: Beijing Mixes Messages Over Anti-Japan Protests
headline.print_headline: Beijing Mixes Messages Over Anti-Japan Protests
